search_information.business: The Vortex Bar And Grill - Midtown

comment.text: The ALPINE STEAK  HOUSE Burger was great but the sauce took over the taste of my burger ( medium rare). Our waitress was very busy with mabey 10 tables, but she somehow worked her magic. We left big tip. CAN'T WAIT TO TRY MY NEXT FLAVOR BURGER. ANY FAVORITE'S OUT THERE?

photos.caption: THE ALPINE STEAK HOUSE was great, but the secret sauce took over the taste of my mid rare burger.

comment.text: Heard about the Vortex for years. First time here. Won't be in a hurry to go back. Parking is outrageously priced . Burgers are good, but nothing to write home about. LOTS of different ingredients and crazy sandwiches. Huge drink menu. Great service is the reason for 4 stars, rather than 3. It's worth a try if you want to experience something different.

I have been coming here for years! It had been a while. I was not disappointed!!  The burgers here are amazing!  The hardest part is deciding which one to order!

They have funnel cake fries!  And the Tots were perfect as always. The burger was juicy and cooked perfectly. You cannot go wrong with any of the burger choices.

Super cool place with a bar feeling. Great beer selection including 2 that are brewed for them. I love the laughing skull amber. 

Service is great. Be aware you can only come in if 21 or older. So leave the kiddos at home!

if i can give her zero i would!!! her name is ryan!! i will contact corporate !! my daughter about to pass out at a table. ask ryan to bring us some fries asap. her reply was an i suppose to pull fries out my assssssss!! wowo!! greay customer service!!! ask for a manager!! the security response was leave we calling the police!!!! that was policy and procedures!!! do not go to vortex for comedy or food or bar!!! they do not cater to blacks!!!

ryan you sucks sucks sucks !! ryan you need to be fired!!!

20 plus of us and myself and family will never never come back until ryan and fake security it out!!!

i will post daily for the the 90 days

About a month ago my wife and I ate at the Vortex in Atlanta and had the worst service of our life. Our waitress named Sky L. made sure that we would never come back. For starters we got there an hour and a half before close and Sky told us we needed to be quick because they were closing soon. She then visited our table 2 more times the rest of the night and when my wife ordered a drink she never brought it and so my wife after 25 minutes went to another waitress after multiple attempts of trying to get our waitresses attention to see about the drink. Sky immediately came to our table then to get upset at my wife for getting another waitresses attention even though she refused to wait on us...After that moment she refused to make eye contact with us or say a word the rest of the night. She also wasn't busy her time was spent in the back and she only had three tables she was waiting on.
This place has the best burgers in Atlanta. Try it, it's just better than anywhere else. The price is surprisingly affordable. Vortex, love you bunches

I came to visit as a good but recommended Vortex and was NOT disappointed!!!

Ebony my server was great and the food was AWESOME!!!  When back in this area I will definitely visit again!!!

This is a cool spot to hang out or go to the comedy show because the decor is interesting. We went on a Saturday night so there was a 45 minute wait for a table. We decided to go to bar and wait there, when seats emptied we sat down and ordered. They were busy so it took a good 20 minutes for the bartender to take out order after we sat down. The appetizer tater tots were very good with the melted cheese on top. The bbq mac and cheese burger was really good but the burger was burnt. We asked for well done but the burger was too well done. The buffalo wings were good but too crispy for my liking.

The Perfect way to Begin my Weekend was going to this place last Friday and eating to the point where I couldn't breathe anymore! 
You can feel the Holiday vibes with their "Blowjob" shot, it has Irish Cream and Kahlua, topped with whipped cream. The Cheese-Balls O' Glory goes really well with their house beer;  
I had the Retro Diner Burger. it consists of two 4-ounce griddled sirloin patties with LTOP. Absolutely loved the food, environment, songs they were playing and of course the servers were very sweet. 
As it's in Peachtree St. of course parking is a little difficult, there are roadside parallel Parkings available if you get lucky to find one, if not, you can always pay $5 and park in the parking garage that's next to PUBLIX. 
Have fun here this weekend!

photos.caption: Badass Buffalo Wings- Sauce on the Side
House Beer  Bourbon- Neat  Blowjob Shot

comment.text: Definitely feel like you pay for the vibe more than anything! The burgers were good, just don't think it was worth the price. Staff was friendly and provided great service!

Such a cool spot! The mushroom and swiss burger was pretty good, but the fried zucchini wasn't any good. The star of the show though... the chicken rolls!! Holy moly they were DELICIOUS!! I'll be back just for those!!

photos.caption: Chicken rolls are a MUST when you visit here!! So delicious!!

comment.text: I have tried so many things on the menu and I am never disappointed. Drinks are great too, I just don't recommend the amber lager. It's too dark and bitter but the other house is good. The food never fails. I do wish their sides were better (definitely tastes like the French fries from the freezer section) but the sandwiches makes up for it. Pickle Rick is the best!!

First time here, loves the vibe, service and of course the food. 
Great value for the amount and quality.

The Vortex was a decent place for lunch. The thing that stood out the most was probably the decor and vibe of the inside. In my opinion it is on the alternative/grudge side. The food was good but not great or memorable. We got the chicken roll appetizers which were probably my favorite part. They were very hot and creamy with a nice flavor. I got the classic bypass burger which was also just...good. The fried plantains were not that good to me, I barely ate them. Overall it is a fine place to eat but I wouldn't spend the money to go back.

Good outing but nothing spectacular. The service was excellent, the atmosphere was fun, but the food was very average. It came out quick and was good, but for the price we expected a bit more. I have had better burgers.

photos.caption: Hells Fury with sauce on the side

comment.text: It was a cluttered old bar in Midtown I wanted to see.  I've seen it.  The Hamburger was 1/2 Pound and Tater Tots were plentiful, for a great price for being located where they are; less than $13. I had 2 Drafts with it and it was $24.?? Before Tip.  Ad the $9 to Park a few hours.  If you're already there, go, but don't go out of your way, nothing stood out.

Disclaimer- this review is based on a DoorDash order of wings and a salad only.  I've had their Burgers and they are good but I rarely go because no parking.
Today I'm craving wings and I'm trying out several local options using the food apps.  
Theses were way overpriced and tiny.  I realize the apps add to the cost but that was definitely not an $8 salad.

photos.caption: Side salad @ Vortex Midtown ATL GA

comment.text:
Really yummy food! Visited for the first time around 7pm on a Tuesday. They do check ID at the door because it is a 21+ establishment. There was no wait, but it was definitely popping. Ordered the 20oz laughing skull, lager for $5! A steal and a delicious beer. For food I got the KA'MANAWA' N ALEI'YA which was (A scoop of chipotle cream cheese, 3 slices of bacon and
spicy pineapple jalape単o jelly on Texas toast for $12.95). Came with side of choice, I chose tater tots. The burger was absolutely delicious. I thought the value was great. Tots were great too and I got a side of ranch to dip in. Service was great. If you're looking for a no frills 21+ burger place this is it. Parking is iffy because midtown, but there are a few pay lots around. Definitely would return.

Save your coins! This plc used to be fun lively with great food - currently they're hugely understaffed! For outdoor eating - forget about it! They basically ignored us for 20 minutes and we had to actually go inside and ask if someone could help us twice! Not even that crowded ! Wait staff terribly lackadaisical! They not in no rush ! Be clear-Took our drink orders and wouldn't take food order even though we were ready -they said someone else would come take food order but of course then no one came ! Had to go back in to request someone to come take our food order! WTH -Won't return ! We asked for check and just paid for our tea and water
Which should have been free considering the service! Sowe left and went to cypress st pint and plate - highly recommend it!

Do yourself a favor and just go! There are so many quirky things to look at, plenty of photo ops , from the giant weenie for good luck at the door, to rwo skeletons riding motorcycles, and a whole lot more in between. The bar has a ton of beer and cocktail options. The menu is more like a book. The food options are amazing. From the Fat Elvis Burger to the quadruple coronary bypass. You cannot leave this place unhappy it would be impossible. Do yourself a favor and check it out you must be 21 and over to enter since it is mostly a bar with an amazing kitchen/grill. 
Don't forget to rub the weenie for luck at the  entrance.

Ashley is one of the rudest servers I have ever encountered in my dining exper. I can't believe she works here and is kept employed. The food was alright but my burger was so over cooked and dry. I would try to find another burger place or do shake shack instead!! The place is loud and the restaurant not the cleanest either

Vortex is my go to for late night drinks and burgers! They have an interesting vibe (intended for mature audiences only lol), but it is definitely a must, especially for their sides & their blue skull crusher drink!

Interesting little bar that only allows 21+ patrons and yes they ID you at the door to make sure. 

We seated ourselves in the dining area and took awe at the decorative selection of the bar. By the way the decorations are pretty interesting and we loved the skull chandeliers. 

They are known for their burgers but the burger was just ok to me. It had a good flavor but I wouldn't put it at the top of my list but it was good. The wings are pretty darn good. Get the cheese bites. Worth it! Hints of jalape単o in the bites and it has a jalape単o ranch that comes with it. 

I got one of their speciality drinks (I can't recall the name right now) and it was strong so be prepared for some liquored up drinks. 

Parking is done by a meter or a parking garage here so add those couple of bucks to your tab or Uber if you come to try it.

Greasy. That's it, that's the post. 
This place is historical & definitely a great spot for social media pics, but the food, is not for the weak .

Delicious burgers, very good service and fascinating atmosphere!  I got the Original Cheeseburger with tater tots.  Choice of cheese. Burgers cooked to order with fresh, crisp toppings.   And one of the Laughing Skull lager beers. All good.  And the waitress took care of us. 

One note, we got in early (5:30 pm or so) on Friday with no wait. When leaving around 6:45 the place had filled up and there appeared to be a small wait.

Great food. I know you're coming to try the coronary burgers and if you're only in town for a few days, do it. Otherwise, I highly recommend the specialty burgers. I got the Elvis burger that has peanut butter and fried plantains. What a banger! Pleasantly surprised. 
My drink was a Savannah Spritz. Very delicious. 
Four stars because my server was kinda off. She was crouching down to eye level and giving other guest great attention. For me and my partner, she'd zip away as quickly as she could. Whatever. 
Also, bathrooms are very clean!
Overall, definitely a spot to try if your in Atlanta or if you're a mega fat-a$$ (in a good way lol)

My husband and I went out for our anniversary last night. This is somewhere he has been with his dad a long time ago we thought it be fun to go out to the same place. There was a 30 minute wait when we got there which wasn't bad because it's Saturday night. After we got seated our waiter was by really quickly to see if we were ready to order drinks. What what husband ordered a golden monkey and I ordered a 10-year-old Scotch. He came back later to get our food order we started with the nachos and added sour cream and jalape単os both were aside charge. My husband ordered the hot burger sorry I don't know the name of it and I ordered the four horsemen. Very good burgers very messy. The nachos were awesome as well exactly what we needed to snack on while drinking waiting for our burgers. After the scotch I ordered the ATLiens which kind of reminded me of a slightly spiced hard lemonade which was very good. I had thought about ordering some more to drink but got too engrossed with the wonderful food.

Thank you for text we will be back.
Very chill divey spot with really good drinks and even better food. The staff is always friendly and this is a place anyone can go to and feel welcome.

We went on a Saturday night so of course the wait was ridiculous but we had so much fun at the bar and taking pics that it went by fast. Food, as always, was incredible. We got a mix of burgers and I tried the turkey chili for the first time. So good!!! Overall, great experience. Got some attitude from a server, but everything else made up for it.

I'm still thinking about these wings!
We had never been to this place until today. The vibe was great, the service was great, the food was great, we even got to see a birthday drink off (which was really cool and made me want to come back for my birthday) All around, It was truly a great outing! Just remember you have to be 21+ to come in at all times!

The funnel stick fries were delicious (not pictured) but were a great recommendation from our waitress for pairs to share!

My only "con" to this specific location is the parking situation. The lot directly across cost $15 to park and with both of us driving we spent $30 parking and $40 on food... it was definitely an expensive outing so my recommendation would be to carpool or park free on a nearby street and walk over.

Peanut butter on  hamburger! Who knew this would work
I had to try it  must admit first bit was interesting, but then you taste the crisp bacon and the sweetness of the fried plantain! Don't know how it happened, but next thing I know the burger was gone! The entire burger! Yes, I'll be back for another thank you!
Also tried, black and white! Guiness with amber ale! Again, couldn't decided if I liked it, till the 2 glass! This may be my drink of the summer! 
2nd time coming to Vortex, I can see this being my go to spot for Guiness and burger!

My husband and I were craving some solid meaty burgers so we ordered take-out from Vortex. The order was ready fairly quickly and it was a positive pickup experience.

Let's start with the burgers. We got one Classic Bypass (topped with a fried egg, American cheese, and bacon) and one Retro Diner Burger (2 sirloin patties, Swiss and Cheddar cheese, grilled onion, dill pickle). Everything was fresh and of good quality. The Retro Diner Burger was exactly what we expected. However, my Classic Bypass was very bland and slightly dry, lacking the smokey grill flavor as well. Overall it's quite different from when we visited in person pre-COVID.

On the positive side, we loved the Dixie Wrecked Taters, tator tots covered in sausage gravy, cheddar cheese, and bacon!! The potato salad, also has bacon and cheese, is to die for!
I'd go back just for these.

We will give it another try when we go back to normal for sure!

This place has a Kuma's Corner feel. We were told to come for the burgers- they were okay. Drinks were basic- the server kept referring to the place as "a dive." But the fried pickles were excellent. I did find it odd that my group (3 minorities) were sat upstairs along with 3 other groups of minorities. When I used the washroom there was 1 black couple in the main seating area- coincidental, perhaps?

Food is A1! Got the barbecue bacon mac and cheese burger with a side of dixie wrecked tots and it did not disappoint! Both foods were solid choices and literally hit home. The flavors in the burger were nice and saucy and the tots just felt like home with the gravy. 10/10 would recommend.

I am a native Atlantan, but had never dined at The Vortex. I am now disappointed in myself that it took so long!!! The burgers were EVERYTHING!!! Very flavorful!!
I had the house salad topped with sirloin burger! It was amazing!!! 
We loved the service and people-watching on the patio!!
WARNING, you must be 21 with ID check at the door. 
There is a huge phallus near the entrance!! It's supposed to bring good luck when rubbed!! :-)

photos.caption: House Salad topped with sirloin burger!!!

comment.text: I love this place mainly for their drinks. It's always a fun spot to start your night. The food is good and the place is decorated in an eclectic way. You can also sit on the patio with a view of the street.  It's always a good time here!

Any burger

I've stayed nearby quite a few times now but have purposefully passed as I've been to one of the other locations some years back and like to check out new spots. That said, I was looking for a post-workout protein fix before I crashed for the night and figured this would be as good of a place as any. This location has the same divey atmosphere I remember and I liked that they were checking people at the door. The menu has a huge selection of fancy burgers and I went with the guac version done medium rare. It was served to perfection with a good helping of fries. Service was attentive and I was even offered a to go cup for my Diet Coke. This would be a great place to stop back for dinner and drinks. I'd definitely do Vortex again over other chains on the block like Taco Mac.

It was super good. The taters were kinda of heavy and a little salty but the burger was really juicy and flavorful. They really have the best burgers and you can't go wrong with their fried pickles. They came out so fresh and the ranch is just spectacular. They put some love into that ranch. They also just have really good pickles in general. The seating was very spread out. Everybody had masks on. The vibe was cool

photos.caption: Swiss & Mushroom w bacon and  Dixie Wrecked Taters

comment.text: just really rude people. Felt unwelcome the minute I walked in till the moment I left.

a must visit bar in atlanta! The food and drinks are both so good. The bacon Mac n cheese burger is SO GOOD and the perfect size sharing with an appetizer for lunch. We also got the chicken wrap appetizer it was great. The decor and the whole restaurant is so cool too

I came with my friends the first time Friday. as a service industry worker, the menu said everything  that's ever needed to be said to the general public. they had an awesome selection of drinks. and the burger I got was the best I'd had in a LONG time. so glad we decided to go, definitely a well known spot in atl for a reason.

A must! Great service, AWESOME food, best burgers & nachos for sure. Great place. Highly recommend it. Returned two days back to back! A must for burger lovers, great local draft beers. Cheers, enjoy! Thank me later...

Overrated. Don't go to the skull lounge l, the ushers are rude. 

The food was okay. The waitress and hostess were amazing. It was loud and we couldn't hear each other talk.
This restaurant was not what I expected. Atmosphere was not conducive for dinner. More of a bar atmosphere. Food was not very good. Cheap food for a premium price. Service was great.

Walk in and just check out the d辿cor. Very cool stuff. Great, unique atmosphere. I have always wanted to try other sandwiches but I always go with a burger. It is just so good its hard to pass up. Service was good, our server was very attentive and orders were accurate.
Food was fairly average.  Food is underseasoned and even though some of the overall appeal is their unhealthy but loaded burgers, they felt like they were lacking flavor.

My hubby and I  have been wanting to try the burgers at the Vortex for awhile. We stopped in the other day while in the area. I usually am not a huge burger aficionado like my better half but I wanted to try one. I picked the 
KA'MANA WA'NA LEI'YA 
A scoop of chipotle cream cheese, 3 slices of bacon and spicy pineapple jalape単o jelly on Texas toast. This burger  was slap your mama good!!! OMGosh Heaven 
The Vortex has ruined me for any other burger. Nothing better than this burger. Seriously.

photos.caption: Vortex burger Ka'Mana wa'na lei'ya   Chipotle cream cheese, pineapple jalape単o jam omg

comment.text: Horrible service. Food was alright. We didn't get our drinks until 10 minutes after our food came. Waitress was so rude for no reason. African American, long hair, short and looks like she put her service under the name "Ryan." This was Monday October 17th for lunch. Took home burger, but didn't finish it and threw it out. Drink tasted like bubble gum and I didn't finish it- just poured it in my water cup LOL since I paid for the glass.

Legit, a good time. The atmosphere is great!  Don't let it fool you, the burgers are great...
The burger with guac was tasty, however the burger with...bbq sauce, Mac and cheese....def was the best !

My first and last time coming here. I moved to Atlanta 6 yrs ago and I've always heard abt the delicious burgers here so we decided to give it a try.  Mannnnn, after being in the restaurant for 90 mins somebody burst my window and went under my seat to steal my job's laptop that was prob worth $400-$500 that I need to use all the time. I'm a Firefighter/Paramedic serving and helping the community and barely making it to survive day to day and some sorry A$$ cost me more money than the laptop is worth. It cost $600 to replace my side windows.  The cop shows up in a timely manner and tells us ppl break in hundreds of cars ALL THE TIME in the parking lot and the cameras do NOT work... So I come out to enjoy a burger and end up spending over $600. I wonder why is t there a security guard posted up. These businesses make lots of $$$ and why aren't the cameras working. I'm 2022 operable Cameras are pretty cheap to installed and operate from an app but I guess the criminal minded person will continued to have a "feast" breaking in cars if no changes are being made. The burgers were great not worth the agony of worrying abt my car being harm.
Gee thanks. I should have gone to Burger King for a burger. . I won't be back..... EVER...
